conclusion.overall_assessment: The Azura dropshipping platform is in good development state with core functionality working (72% complete). Product browsing, cart, checkout, and payments operate end-to-end. However, several critical gaps prevent production deployment: guest checkout, return workflow completeness, refund processing, and email notifications are incomplete. CJ integration is 60% complete and requires variant sync, warehouse UI, and delivery method integration. Testing coverage is minimal. With 74 estimated development hours on critical and high-priority items, the platform could be production-ready in 2-3 weeks.
conclusion.recommendation: Address CRITICAL items immediately (16 hours), then HIGH priority items (30 hours). Defer MEDIUM priority to post-launch. Focus on: (1) Guest checkout, (2) Return approval workflow, (3) Refund processor, (4) Email templates, (5) CJ integration completion, (6) Core feature tests.
main_risks: Returns/refunds cannot be completed - revenue leak risk
Guest checkout missing - sales conversion drop
No email notifications - poor customer experience
Minimal test coverage - production bugs likely
